Docs.summary: This is a primary interface in a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this primary interface only when the method you want to use shares the same name as an event of the COM object; in this case, cast to this interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Otherwise, use the .NET interface that is derived from the COM coclass to access methods, properties, and events of the COM object. For information about the COM object, see .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoSize { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that automatically sizes the control to display the entire contents. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value for this property is False.
For a single-line text box, setting AutoSize to True automatically sets the width of the display area to the length of the text in the text box.

For a multiline text box that contains no text, setting AutoSize to True automatically displays the text as a column. The width of the text column is set to accommodate the widest letter of that font size. The height of the text column is set to display the entire text of the text box. For a multiline text box that contains text, setting AutoSize to True automatically extends the text box vertically to display the entire text. The width of the text box does not change.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoTab { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies if a tab is inserted automatically when the control has been filled to the maximum length specified. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value for this property is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoWordSelect { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies whether a word or a character is the basic unit used to extend a selection. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::UInt32 BackColor { System::UInt32 get(); void set(System::UInt32 value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a UInteger (uint in C#) value that indicates the background color of the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is of the type OLE_COLOR which is a UInteger (uint in C#) value. The default value for this property is 0x80000005, "Window."

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlBorderStyle BorderStyle { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlBorderStyle get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlBorderStyle value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that defines the style of the border around the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is olBorderStyleSingle.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clear() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes the text in the text box.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Copy() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Copies the contents of the control to the clipboard.

remarks.para: The data is copied in unformatted text format, replacing the existing contents of the clipboard.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Cut() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes the contents of the control and copies the contents to the clipboard.

remarks.para: The data is copied to the clipboard in unformatted text format, replacing the existing contents of the clipboard.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlDragBehavior DragBehavior { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlDragBehavior get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlDragBehavior value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that indicates whether the system enables the drag-and-drop feature for this control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is olDragDropDisabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Enabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that indicates if the control is allowed to function. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableRichText { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: This object, member, or enumeration is deprecated and is not intended to be used in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlEnterFieldBehavior EnterFieldBehavior { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlEnterFieldBehavior get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlEnterFieldBehavior value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that specifies the selection behavior when entering the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is olEnterFieldBehaviorSelectAll.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnterKeyBehavior { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that defines the way the ENTER key behaves in the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: When this property is True, pressing ENTER creates a new line. When this property is False, pressing ENTER moves the focus to the next control in tab order. The default value for this property is False.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Font As StdFont
public: property stdole::StdFont ^ Font { stdole::StdFont ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an StdFont that represents the font used to render the text inside the control. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::UInt32 ForeColor { System::UInt32 get(); void set(System::UInt32 value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a UInteger (uint in C#) value that indicates the foreground color of the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is of the type OLE_COLOR which is a UInteger (uint in C#) value. The default value for this property is 0x80000008, "Window Text."

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HideSelection { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies if a selection is displayed or hidden for the control when the control loses focus. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value of this property is True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IntegralHeight { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies whether this control displays full lines of text. Read/write.

remarks.para: If this property is True, the control displays fill lines of text; otherwise it displays partial lines. The default value is True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Locked { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies whether or not the control is locked from being changed. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is False.
When the control is locked, the control does not have a "disabled" appearance, but the user cannot edit the contents of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxLength { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value that specifies the maximum number of characters for the of this control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is zero, which only means that no maximum length for the value has been defined for this control. A maximum length may still be in place based on available memory or other factors.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property stdole::StdPicture ^ MouseIcon { stdole::StdPicture ^ get(); void set(stdole::StdPicture ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a StdPicture that represent the custom picture to the mouse cursor for this control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is Nothing (a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) in C#).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlMousePointer MousePointer { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlMousePointer get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlMousePointer value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that specifies the type of pointer displayed when the user positions the mouse over the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is olMousePointerDefault.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MultiLine { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies whether a control can accept and display multiple lines of text. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PasswordChar { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) that specifies a placeholder character that is to be displayed repetitively as a string instead of the actual characters entered in the text box. Read/write.

remarks.para: A common application of setting this property to True is password entry, where you would not want to display the actual characters of the password that the user enters in the text box. The default value is an empty string.

Only one character is accepted for the value of this property. If a string of more than one character is set, only the first character will be used as the placeholder character and the rest will be ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Paste() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Pastes the contents of the clipboard in the control.

remarks.para: The contents of the clipboard are pasted in unformatted text.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlScrollBars Scrollbars { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlScrollBars get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlScrollBars value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that specifies whether the control has a vertical scroll bar, horizontal scroll bar, or both. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is olScrollBarsNone.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SelectionMargin { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies whether the user can select a line of text by clicking in the region to the left of the text. Read/write.

remarks.para: If True, clicking in the margin causes selection of text. If False, this action does not select any text. The default value is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SelLength { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value that specifies the number of characters in the current selection. Read/write.

remarks.para: The current selection is specified by , which is a portion of the control's . The maximum number of characters that can be supported for Value is .
The default value is zero, which means no text is currently selected.
The SelLength property is always valid, even when the control does not have focus.
Setting SelLength to a value less than zero causes an error. Attempting to set the value greater than MaxLength results in setting SelLength to MaxLength.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SelStart { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value that specifies either the starting point of the selected text or the insertion point if no text has been selected. Read/write.

remarks.para: The current selection is specified by , which is a portion of the control's . The maximum number of characters that can be supported for Value is .
The default value is zero, which means no text is selected and the insertion point is at the beginning.

The SelStart property is always valid, even when the control does not have focus. Setting SelStart to a value less than zero causes an error. Setting SelStart to a value greater than MaxLength will reset SelStart to MaxLength. Changing the value of SelStart cancels any existing selection, places the insertion point in the text, and sets the SelLength property to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SelText As String
public: property System::String ^ SelText { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) that represents the currently selected portion of the value of the text box. Read-only.

remarks.para: SelText represents the current selection, which is a portion of the control's . The maximum number of characters that can be supported for Value is .
The default value is an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TabKeyBehavior { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies how the control responds to the TAB key. Read/write.

remarks.para: If this property is True, pressing TAB inserts a tab character in the text box. If this property is False, focus moves to the next control in the tab order.
The default value is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Text { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) that is the text displayed in the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value of the Text property is the empty string.
The Text property provides the same value as the property, but the value is strongly typed as a String (string in C#).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlTextAlign TextAlign { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlTextAlign get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlTextAlign value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that specifies how text is aligned in the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is olTextAlignLeft in left-to-right languages such as English.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public Property Value As Object
public: property System::Object ^ default { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Object that represents the content of the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The value is the same as the value of , except that this property is Object and Text is strongly typed as String (string in C#).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool WordWrap { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that specifies whether the contents of a control automatically wrap at the end of a line. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is True.
